To conduct a "Needs Assessment of Unemployed Youths in Hong Kong"
To subsidise the establishment of a Minimally Invasive Surgical Skills Centre at Prince of Wales Hospital
To fund its Chinese Music Archive for five years
To fund the setting-up of a food composition database for nutrition labelling (HKSAR Chief Executive's Community Projects List)

Four items: 88,720 to fund the establishment of a Sports Medicine and Health Sciences Centre and cover its operating cost for three years; 64,840 to pilot run the Jockey Club Sign Bilingualism and Co-enrolment in Deaf Education Programme, with a view to enhancing education opportunities of people with hearing impairment; 16,100 to fund a five-year project to promote public awareness of bowel cancer and facilitate access to bowel cancer screening (HKSAR Chief Executive's Community Projects List); 2,320 to fund a pilot home-based nursing service for people with chronic heart failure for three years
To fund its Jockey Club School of Public Health and Primary Care to operate the CUHK Jockey Club Community Primary Care Programme for three years

Two items: 15,890 to fund a five-year cancer prevention and screening programme to combat the rising threat of bowel cancer in Hong Kong; 10,450 to fund the setting-up of an Integrative Medical Clinic in the Prince of Wales Hospital
Two items: 12,000 to fund the setting-up and operation of an Institute of Ageing for five years; 1,312,000 to fund the establishment of a teaching hospital on its campus in Sha Tin

Two items: 3,550 to fund the development of an AgeWatch Index for Hong Kong and publication of the findings on an annual basis for five years by its Jockey Club Institute of Ageing; 137,440 to fund its research postgraduate hostel project

Three items: 48,500 to fund the promotion of school-based talent development and gifted education in Hong Kong for three years; 11,290 to fund a community primary care programme for older people with chronic conditions for three years; 10,040 to fund the Jockey Club Centre for Osteoporosis Care and Control to implement a Fall and Fracture Prevention Programme for older people for three years

Six items: 28,120 to fund the development of a framework of intergenerational and healthy ageing programmes, co-ordination with non-governmental organisations to implement a series of intergenerational programmes for four years; 9,180 to fund a stepped-care online self-help and support service project on mental health for three years; 8,230 to fund part of the set-up cost of the Yunus Social Business Centre and to launch a three-year youth programme; 44,710 to fund the Childrens Eye Care Programme at its Eye Centre for three years; 35,700 to fund the operation and development of its Jockey Club Museum of Climate Change for three years; 33,530 to fund the Ophthalmic Microsurgical Training Programme at its Eye Centre for three years

notes_non-annual: To support the Youth Pre-employment Training Programme
To sponsor the Hong Kong Jockey Club Summer Internship Programme for university students in Hong Kong
To set up the Jockey Club Life-Wide Learning Fund for five years to provide financial assistance for needy students in Primary 5 to Secondary 3 to participate in life-wide learning activities
To subsidise the establishment of a 3-year award scheme for student leaders at S6 level to participate in nine study programmes on today's China in Beijing

To fund the extension of The Hong Kong Jockey Club Life-wide Learning Fund for five years until 2012, with an expansion of scope to subsidise financially needy students from Primary 1 to Secondary 7 to participate in life-wide learning activities

To fund the extension of The Hong Kong Jockey Club Life-wide Learning Fund for three years from 2012/13 to 2014/15 to subsidise financially needy primary and secondary students to participate in life-wide learning activities
To fund The Hong Kong Jockey Club Life-wide Learning Fund for three more years from 2015 to 2018
Three items: 190 for Study Room Scheme; 7 for Duke of Edinburgh Award Scheme; 1,000 for Library Books for Teachers' Training Colleges & Technical Institutes
Computing Equipment for Schools
Two items: 1,930 for Micro-computer Systems; 1,160 for Research in Gifted Education
Identification of Academically Gifted Children
Chinese Hand Writing Recognition Systems
Two items: 15,000 to launch a two-year pilot "District Teacher Network Scheme"; 1,200 to subsidise five residential language camps in summer of 2000 for secondary school students
To fund the iSee World Global Education Programme for three years
To furnish and equip a new school in Tin Shui Wai, Yuen Long
To implement a territory-wide Healthy Ageing Campaign for three years

notes_non-annual: To provide assistance to people who are in need of urgent relief

Five items: 1,500 to provide assistance to 73 victim families whose homes were damaged by flooding; 990 to provide assistance to 15 victims and their families of the Manila Hostage Tragedy; 200 to provide assistance to two families whose members were killed in a fatal fire in Ma Tau Wai Road; 200 to provide assistance to the families of two workers who were killed in a workplace accident; 100 to provide assistance to the family of a drainage worker who died in a manhole accident

Nineteen items: 3,260 for families of the deceased and affected households of Fa Yuen Street fire accident; 200 for the families of two construction workers who died in an industrial accident at Tsuen Wan; 120 for the affected households of the Wah Fu Estate fire accident; 100 for a student who has become tetraplegic in an accident, to meet part of the various expenses on rehabilitation, nursing care and special transportation; 100 for the family of a worker who died in an industrial accident at the new Legislative Council Complex; 100 for the family of a worker who died in an industrial accident at Hung Hom; 100 for the family of a worker who died in a traffic accident at the Peak; 100 for the family of a worker who died in an industrial accident at New Clear Water Bay Road; 100 for the family of a refuse collection vehicle driver who died in a traffic accident at Kwai Chung; 100 for the family of a worker who died in an industrial accident at Tai Wai; 100 for the family of a restaurant cook who died in his workplace; 100 for the family of a security guard who died in his workplace; 100 for the family of a worker who died in a traffic accident at Kwun Tong; 100 for two sisters whose parents died in an incident; 100 for a family who lost their parents in an incident; 50 for the family of a worker who died in an industrial accident at Yau Ma Tei; 40 for the affected household of the Cheung Ching Estate fire accident; 40 for a woman who faced a family crisis; 20 for an elderly person whose residence was seriously damaged by fire

Twenty-two items; 3,200 for the victim families of a vessel collision off Lamma Island; 250 for the victim families of an industrial accident on the artificial island being built off Chek Lap Kok for the Hong Kong-Zhuhai-Macau Bridge; 240 for the victim families of a fire in the stilt houses in Tai O; 150 for the victim families of an out-of-control bus crash in Shau Kei Wan; 100 for the family of the deceased worker in a construction accident at Tseung Kwan O; 100 for two sisters who faced financial hardship due to the death of their parents; 100 for a little boy who faced financial hardship due to the death of his parents; 100 for a student of the Hong Kong Institute of Education who suffered a bike accident; 100 for the family of an electrician who died in his workplace; 100 for the family of a taxi driver who died in a traffic accident; 100 for the family of a tourist guide who died in an accident while leading a tour in Turkey; 100 for the family of a part-time overnight shift worker who passed away suddenly; 100 for the family of a truck driver who died in his workplace; 100 for the family of a delivery worker who died in his workplace; 100 for the victim family of a bus driver who died in a fatal traffic accident in Aberdeen; 60 for the family of a deceased security guard; 50 for a family who faced financial hardship due to the death of their son; 50 for the family of a taxi driver who died in a traffic accident at Disneyland; 50 the family of a baker who died in his workplace; 20 for the family of a cleansing worker who died in a traffic accident while at work; 15 for the victim family of a murder in Tai Kok Tsui

Four items: 1,155 for sixteen families who faced financial hardship due to their main breadwinner dying in or being affected by traffic, construction or other accidents; 660 for the victim families of a fire in Wo Ping New Village in Hung Shui Kiu; 597 for ten families who faced financial hardship due to the sudden death of their main breadwinner; 59 for three families with special financial need

Four items: 517 for twenty-four families of fires or other natural disasters; 510 for ten families who faced financial hardship due to the sudden death of their main breadwinners; 497 for ten families and individuals with special financial needs; 220 for four families who faced financial hardship due to the death of main breadwinners or being affected by traffic, construction or other accidents

Four items: 577 for 12 families who faced financial hardship due to the sudden death of their main breadwinner; 171 for six families who fell victim to fires or other natural disasters; 306 for eight families and individuals with special financial needs; 97 for two families who faced financial hardship due to their main breadwinner dying in or being affected by traffic, construction or other accidents

Four items: 191 to provide assistance to five families who faced financial hardship due to the sudden death of their main breadwinner; 376 to provide assistance to 14 families who fell victim to fires and other natural disasters; 426 to provide assistance to nine families with special financial needs; 334 to provide assistance to six families who faced financial hardship due to their main breadwinner dying in or being affected by traffic, construction or other accidents

notes_non-annual: To subsidise the establishment of the Jockey Club Environmental Conservation Gallery at the Hong Kong Science Museum
To fund the instant relay of two concerts performed by the Berlin Philharmonic Orchestra

Two items: 2,640 to fund the education programmes of "The Ancient Olympic Games" Exhibition at the Hong Kong Heritage Museum; 2,520 to fund the organisation of "The Deep" exhibition at the Hong Kong Science Museum
To sponsor the 2009 East Asian Games in Hong Kong
Two items: 10,000 to stage an Exhibition of the River of Wisdom - Animated Version of Riverside Scene at the Qingming Festival in Hong Kong; 3,500 to fund the 3rd Hong Kong Games in 2011

To stage two Mega Exhibitions - "The Majesty of All Under Heaven: The Eternal Realm of China's First Emperor" and "A Lofty Retreat from the Red Dust: The Secret Garden of Emperor Qianlong" in Hong Kong in 2012

Three items: 15,430 to fund three Exhibitions/Education programmes in Hong Kong in 2013: The Wonders of Ancient Mesopotamia, The Splendours of Royal Costume: Qing Court Attire and Andy Warhol: 15 Minutes Eternal; 5,000 to sponsor the 4th Hong Kong Games; 1,820 to fund two Student Events and a Transportation Subsidy Scheme cum Guided Tour at the Hong Kong Flower Show 2013

Four items: 3500 to fund a pilot museum project "Journey for Active Minds : Jockey Club Museum Programme for the Elderly" as an age-friendly initiative for the elderly and Alzheimer's patients for 18 months; 17,000 to fund three exhibitions in Hong Kong in 2014: "Legends of the Giant Dinosaurs", "Studio Ghibli Layout Designs: Understanding the Secrets of Takahata and Miyazaki Animation" and "Ju Ming - Sculpting the Living World"; 17,000 to fund two exhibitions in Hong Kong in 2015: "Treasures from Tsarskoye Selo: Residence of the Russian Emperors" and "Dunhuang: Untold Tales, Untold Riches"; 3,470 to fund two Student Events and a Transportation Subsidy Scheme cum Guided Tour at the Hong Kong Flower Show 2014

Four items: 17,000 tofund three exhibitions in Hong Kong in 2015/16 under the Hong Kong Jockey Club Series: "The Rise of the Celestial Empire: Consolidation and Cultural Exchange during the Han Dynasty", "Western Scientific Instruments of the Qing Court" and "The Radiant Ming 1368-1644 through the Min Chiu Society Collection"; 8,130 to fund the upgrade of the artefacts and multi-media installations of the Museum of Art on Wheels and an art outreach learning programme for three years; 6,000 to support the 5th Hong Kong Games; 3,770 to fund five educational initiatives at the Hong Kong Flower Show 2015

Three items: 13,100 to fund two exhibitions in Hong Kong in the 2016/17 The Hong Kong Jockey Club Series: "Mare Nostrum - Roman Navy and Pompeii" and "Royal Wedding Ceremony of the Qing Dynasty"; 7,000 to fund the 6th Hong Kong Games in 2017; 4,990 to fund six educational initiatives at the Hong Kong Flower Show 2016

Three items: 31,500 to fund three exhibitions in Hong Kong in 2017/18 under The Hong Kong Jockey Club Series: Eternal Life  Exploring Ancient Egypt, Longevity and Virtues: Birthday Celebrations of the Qing Emperors and Empress Dowagers and Hall of Mental Cultivation of The Palace Museum  Imperial Residence of Eight Emperors; 8,660 to fund a public engagement and education programme on Chinese history and culture; 5,300 to fund the six educational initiatives at the Hong Kong Flower Show 2017

notes_non-annual: To fund the development and operations of an online volunteer matching platform for two years, under an initiative to promote volunteerism in Hong Kong
1,000 for Renovation & Equipment for Group Work Units; 2,300 for Urban Hostel for Street Sleepers
Air-conditioning for 60 Day Nurseries
Family Corners in 13 Group Work Units
International Year of the Family (IYF) 1994
Air-conditioning Systems at Elderly Centres

Two items: 97,230 to partially fund the rehabilitation complexes at Lai King Headland and Castle Peak Hospital; 1,478 to install air-conditioning systems at its Choi Wan and Wing Lung Bank Golden Jubilee Sheltered Workshop and Hostels
To acquire non-standard furniture and equipment in 39 day care centres for the elderly, 163 residential care homes for the elderly, and six nursing homes to enhance care for increasingly frail elders
To co-subsidise the Intensive Employment Assistance Projects with the Lotteries Fund for four years

Two items: 49,640 to fund the establishment of a transitional care and support centre for tetraplegic patients and support its operating costs for four years (HKSAR Chief Executive's Community Projects List); 7,153 to fund the enhancement of information technology access of visually impaired persons
To fund the procurement of non-standard furniture and equipment for 75 Residential Care Homes for the Elderly
To provide emergency relief funds to victims of the collapsed building at Ma Tau Wai Road

To support the "Jockey Club Elderly Facilities Modernisation Scheme" for elderly centres to procure upgraded facilities as part of the Improvement Programme of Elderly Centres launched by the Social Welfare Department
To fund the Jockey Club Hong Kong Homeless World Cup 2006 - Kick Off Poverty Charity Tournament, sponsor Dawn Homeless Football Team's trip to South Africa and subsequent volunteer service
